Class Oil

  • java.lang.Object
    • RenderableObject
      • Item
        • Oil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GlobalHelper

    public class Oil
extends Item

    Oil

    Represents the Oil item and its effect

    One of the three items that can be used by Player. This item is a fairly standard example of an item which has a simple active effect. Upon use an oil slick is created. This is destroyed upon collision with a Racer, the control for which is handled by the Racer itself. Upon collision with this Racer, the effect described in applyEffect() is applied, which causes it to "spin out" for a set duration.
    Author:
    Daniel Porteous porteousd 696965

    • Constructor Detail

      • Oil

        public Oil(double startX,
           double startY,
           java.lang.String itemPath)
    throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Calls the super constructor as well as initially setting the inactive version of the sprite. The itemPath is stored for later use, and the item is set to being inactive.
        Parameters:
        startX - In pixels. Horizontal x-coordinate starting position.
        startY - In pixels. Vertical y-coordinate starting position.
        itemPath - The folder name of where the items are stored.
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

    • Method Detail

      • applyEffect

        public boolean applyEffect(Racer racer,
                           java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
                    throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        This method applies the effect of the item. If the item is inactive, the item's effect is just to create an active version of itself on the map to then be removed from the inventory of the Player, as is handled by the first part of this method. The parts following handle interactions where the active form of the Oil (slick form) has collided with a player and applies the spinning effect, which is common to Tomato as well and therefore held in Item.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in class Item
        Parameters:
        racer - The Racer to which it should apply the effect.
        mapItems - This is passed so when the item is used, it can be re-added to the game world in its active form.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the effect duration has completed (i.e. Boost duration or duration for which to apply the Oil/Tomato effect).
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException

      • update

        public boolean update(World world)
        Since the Oil slick just sits there on the map and doesn't have any removal condition besides being run into by a player, this just stays empty.
        Specified by:
        update in class Item
        Parameters:
        world - The world object. Mandatory as per the abstract method in Item, but not used here.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item being updated needs to be removed from the map, used only for Tomato since its the only item with an additional removal condition that isn't collision with a Racer, namely collision with terrain.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Fairly self explanatory. If the item is active it will return as such. This is used to tell whether it should be interacted with as an item that hasn't been picked up yet, or a dangerous projectile with an active effect.
        Specified by:
        isActive in class Item
        Returns:
        Returns true if the item is in its active state on the map.
